posts.name: Declan Dunn
posts.cooked:
So this may be a simple question whose answer I’ve just overlooked, but anywho, I am trying to copy the base Elastic dashboard example provided, namely with the SwerveDrive widget. I can’t really figure out how to get that to work, the issue I’m having is that I can get the states to display in the AdvantageScope swerve drivetrain visualizer, but I can’t figure out how to mimic that in the Elastic dashboard. Thanks for any help!

Robot github

Example layout, with the SwerveDrive widget example_layout 1920×950 228 KB

example_layout 1920×950 228 KB

example_layout 1920×950 228 KB

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: frc-elastic.gitbook.io Custom Widget Examples | Elastic Documentation // in DriveSubsystem.java public DriveSubsystem() { ... SmartDashboard.putData("Swerve", builder -> { builder.setSmartDashboardType("SwerveDrive"); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Front Left Angle", () -> m_frontLeft.getPosition().angle.getRadians(), null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Front Left Velocity", () -> m_frontLeft.getPosition().speedMetersPerSecond, null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Front Right Angle", () -> m_frontRight.getPosition().angle.getRadians(), null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Front Right Velocity", () ->m_frontRight.getPosition().speedMetersPerSecond, null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Back Left Angle", () -> m_rearLeft.getPosition().angle.getRadians(), null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Back Left Velocity", () -> m_rearLeft.getPosition().speedMetersPerSecond, null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Back Right Angle", () -> m_rearRight.getPosition().angle.getRadians(), null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Back Right Velocity", () -> m_rearRight.getPosition().speedMetersPerSecond, null); builder.addDoubleProperty( "Robot Angle", () -> getHeading().getRadians(), null); }); }

posts.name: John Fogarty
posts.cooked: The SwerveModuleState contains the velocity value.

posts.name: sam liu
posts.cooked: Sorry, my bad, you have to change all the getPosition to getState() .

posts.name: Declan Dunn
posts.cooked: So this is just a side question in a similar vein to this, how would I display the pathplanner trajectory inside of my field2d widget? Just for debugging and such.

posts.name: Brad
posts.cooked: Doesn’t your other threa d answer this?

posts.cooked: Well, after changing many different parts of the code, I was able to get field2d to work correctly, but even with the snippet added, the trajectory wasn’t displayed. I didn’t want to ask in that thread because I already said it worked to you and I didn’t want to be an inconvenience by saying it didn’t lol
